text: Useful thread by former @CDCgov director @DrTomFrieden citing the excellent work done by CDC on #COVID19. Key will be letting these smart, dedicated professionals lead our response, not silencing or marginalizing them. https://t.co/YLZuRwUwb4

Most valuable #COVID19 review of the week. Strongly recommended!

Plus, it's further evidence of the brilliance of ID fellows, which is always a joy to see. @IDSAInfo @IDSAMedEdCOP @BrighamWomens @mgh_id https://t.co/h91KVgFUTF

@JGPharmD "COVID-19 is a pandemic infection caused by the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2. First identified in Wuhan, China, it has subsequently spread to multiple continents, infecting x [out of date #], leading to x [out of date #] deaths. Clinical presentation of COVID-19 blah blah ..."
After someone has #COVID19, does your workplace require negative PCR testing for SARS-CoV-2 before that person can return to work? Asking in light of recent CDC, Korea data. Comments welcome.

Some thoughts on how we can provide more useful public health messages regarding #COVID19, inspired by local (head-scratching) signs in public parks, missing tennis, and the fine work of @mugecevik @JuliaLMarcus and @ErinBromage. Latest: https://t.co/3HCywWeqJU

Here's the sign up in our local parks. Given what we know about COVID-19 transmission, does this make sense? Or is it too restrictive? Asking for a friend ...  @TownofBrookline https://t.co/5PwxJD5NZS

In honor of #NursesWeek2020, here's some gratitude to those spending more direct care to people with #COVID19 than any other healthcare professionals -- inpatient nurses. Thank you! Latest: https://t.co/3QALWLg6ye
The consistent lack of sympathy for people with #COVID19 remains a significant and painful deficit. https://t.co/OUYL4AgJBz https://t.co/tz4k8dOGXU

There's anecdotal experience ... and then there's anecdotal experience based on observing nearly 200 patients, offered by a skilled, experienced clinician. 
It's subjective, yes, but still useful!

Thank you, @FranciscoMarty_ and your team for tireless work during #COVID19. https://t.co/WKNUtS6n5d

As HCQ slips from favor as a #COVID19 treatment, might it still have a role in prevention?

Plus, anything involving Raphy Landovitz (@doc_in_a_box) and infection prevention is worth our attention, he's awesome. https://t.co/FlzEQojRFA
